My favorite part was the Restobar on the roof with the excellent staff- they seem to love their job, and that's where I met the GM and Chef twice (they were not drinking, but making sure guests are taken care of). Anyway, the Wi-Fi worked for five days without having to log in every time, the security was excellent, and the best part was the list of recommended restaurants for guests upon arrival. They were great with extensive menus, and I ate at them and enjoyed the vast selection, but the service didn't match the quality of service at this hotel. Pengalaman Sangat Buruk Pertama kali saya alami saat menginap di hotel Novotel Suites Mallioboro. Saya menginap 13 juli 2024 dan memilih hotel ini karena sangat dekat dengan tempat saya beracara di tanggal 14 Juli 2024 jam 04.00 meskipun sebenarnya dalam proses pemesanan hotel Juga mengalami kendala dan ketidaknyamanannya. Saya tidak akan membahas mengenai hal tersebut namun hal yang membuat saya marah, kecewa dengan pelayanan yang diberikan sekelas hotel Bintang 4 ini. Tanggal 14 Juli 2024 saya keluar dari kamar untuk aktivitas jam 04.00, posisi barang-barang pribadi saya rapikan dan dimasukan ke dalam koper dan tertinggal perlengkapan mandi di kamar mandi. Selesai aktivitas jam 09.00 saya kembali ke hotel dan langsung menuju tempat breakfast. Sekitar pukul 09.30 saya kembali menuju kamar dan betapa terkejutnya saya bahwa kamar saya dalam kondisi terbuka, selimut, bed cover sudah dalam kondisi tidak di tempat tidur. Padahal saya saat itu belum cek out dan tidak ada konfirmasi ke saya dari pihak hotel bahwa saya sudah cek out atau belum. Saya kemudian langsung cek koper, dan masih beruntung ternyata koper dan barang berharga masih tertinggal di kamar. Bagaimana hal ini bisa terjadi sekelas hotel Bintang 4?? Saat cek out saya menemui Pak Sapto, duty manager saat itu. Beliau menyampaikan permintaan maaf dengan alasan crew dilapangan salah dengar instruksi dari FO terkait kamar cek out yang seharusnya kamar 811 menjadi 911. Sebenarnya bagi saya itu bukan alasan yang masuk akal untuk hotel sekelas Novotel yang dalam pikiran saya tiap lantai pastinya ada PIC yang bertugas masing-masing. Pada dasarnya saya tidak mau memperpanjang hal ini, pada saat itu juga saya tidak meminta kompensasi apa-apa. Hanya saya minta ke Pak Sapto untuk membuat permintaan maaf tertulis dan disampaikan segera ke email saya. Saya beri waktu di hari senin, namun mungkin saya terlalu berekspektasi terlalu tinggi terhadap ketulusan hotel ini meminta maaf. Sampai hari selasa sore tanggal 16 Juli 2024 dimana ulasan ini saya tulis, surat tersebut belum saya terima. Sungguh pelayanan dan handling customer yang sangat buruk dari hotel ini, kalau bukan dekat dengan tempat acara pasti saya memilih hotel lain yang hospitality jauh lebih baik dari hotel ini.

I booked 2 rooms (1 via Agoda and 1 direct). The website described a sofa bed in the superior studio king or twin beds room, but it doesn't function as a sofa bed. When I asked, the receptionist explained that only the room with the king-size bed has the sofa bed. Seriously? I was so disappointed, and the hotel even had the cheek to want to charge an additional Rp450,000 for an extra bed. If it weren't for the friendliness of the staff and their willingness to do their utmost for you, I would have given a 1-star rating. Red and brown stains on the bed linen are not acceptable. The fridge in the room does not function properly (for display purposes only, according to the receptionist). Upon check-in, the facility, breakfast time, and Accor Loyalty Membership were not explained. I only found out about the Accor member benefits when paying for drinks at the pool bar, and when I came down to reception to claim the points, they said only the room booked directly with the hotel can claim points. Information on TV does not work properly - all gimmicky. The TV and hairdryer stopped working - I had to call an engineer. The hairdryer in the room does not work at all. Claiming to be a 4-star hotel but using shampoo/soap dispenser in the shower that doesn't function properly, and I had to ask the engineer to remove the bottles from the bracket so I could use the shampoo and soap. No small towels were provided in both rooms on arrival. The next day, only 1 room was given small towels. Tissues had a funny smell as they are kept in a leather-like box. Not sure how long they have been in there. My credit card was charged before I arrived at the hotel, and I had to contact my bank to ensure the refund was processed immediately. Considering I made many calls to Reception to report the issues, nobody from management offered acknowledgement. No management in sight during our stay (16 & 17 April 2024). Good location in the center of Malioboro - other than that, I am not sure if it is worth the money.

We stayed 4 nights at Novotel Suites Yogyakarta Malioboro in the Superior Studio room with a King sized bed. This is a hotel that was built in 1997 and last renovated in 2019 so we were a little surprised by the condition of the hotel and the room. Check-in was easy and the front desk staff were all very friendly and helpful (5 stars for all the staff). The room was very spacious and the bed was comfortable. We had a view of the city which was nice. The bathroom had a weird layout which didn‚Äôt work well. But the biggest complaint was the mold in the corner of the room near the shower and along the edges of the carpet. Other aspects of the room seemed dated as well. The walls between room seem very thin and you can often hear your neighbors or sounds from the hallway. Overall the hotel seemed very dated for one that had supposedly been renovated in 2019. Our room included a breakfast which was buffet style and located on the 8th floor. Unfortunately this is also the smoking floor so when you get off the elevator for breakfast you are confronted with the smell of cigarette smoke. You get used to it in Indonesia but still I think maybe the smoking rooms should be on a different floor for those sensitive to the smell of smoke. The buffet breakfast was excellent (5 stars for the food and staff). Lots of options from traditional Indonesian dishes to Western food and a large dining area with outside seating for those that smoke and eat. Bayu was great at making omelets and the rest of the staff were also very friendly and helpful. Made in particular was super helpful and provided great service. The drop off and pickup point of the hotel is odd. There is only a single way in and out so your driver has to turn around to go back out the same way and it‚Äôs quite tight especially when busy. The best part of this hotel is the location to Malioboro street. You are literally right there and can enjoy the shops, restaurants and sights easily by foot. There is a shopping mall right there and oddly a disconnected mall on several of the lower floors of the hotel itself (Malioboro Mall). We stumbled upon it by accident and access seems to have been limited (closed off to the main mall) which unfortunately has affected all the businesses at this location. Overall it was an OK stay and every staff member that we encountered was always super friendly and helpful. I‚Äôd probably stay here again just for the great location to Malioboro street and all the activities there but my wife said she would not stay here again.

To the GM of Novotel Yogyakarta: My wife and I stayed for 7N at Novotel Yogyakarta. We were celebrating our wedding anniversary. Although things were not quite to our satisfaction at first, we ended our stay very well and it's all thanks to two managers who were exceptionally helpful. Mr Windhu helped us at the start and Ms Fitria Ariani (@Ms AI) subsequently took over that duty. We want to commend Novotel for their excellent choice of hires of these two wonderful managers. Mr Windhu was very empathetic when we voiced our unhappiness. As the manager in charge, we could sense his willingness and helpfulness to assist us in making things right for us, instead of just trivializing our unhappiness. Ms AI who took over our case ensured that our every little need was met from the time she took over until the time when we left the hotel. Her special attention to us made us feel like we were VVVIPs and it really touched our hearts how she would go out of her way to ensure that we had the best remaining stay in Novotel. Both Mr Windhu and Ms AI went way and above their call of duties to make our stay at Novotel Yogyakarta a truly memorable one. We are grateful to God to have met these two angels who have made our stay so pleasant. Their commitment to their jobs is absolutely commendable. They are the kind of role model managers to all their staff and they should be promoted when a position is available. Novotel should retain them as much as possible as they are BIG assets to Novotel. In a nutshell, we think that Novotel can be that brilliant first choice hotel for anyone if Novotel were to pay a bit more attention to the cleanliness state of the room, the breakfast served as well as the massage services. Novotel Yogyakarta already has very good location, very helpful staff and coupled with these two angelic managers, Novotel is not very far off from being one of the best hotels in Yogyakarta if they would just work on these areas of improvement. In conclusion, we would like to offer our deepest thanks to Ms AI, Mr Windhu and all that friendly Novotel staff for all the help rendered to us. We truly appreciate it. May god bless you all!

Pengalaman Sangat Buruk Pertama kali saya alami saat menginap di hotel Novotel Suites Mallioboro. Saya menginap 13 juli 2024 dan memilih hotel ini karena sangat dekat dengan tempat saya beracara di tanggal 14 Juli 2024 jam 04.00 meskipun sebenarnya dalam proses pemesanan hotel Juga mengalami kendala dan ketidaknyamanannya. Saya tidak akan membahas mengenai hal tersebut namun hal yang membuat saya marah, kecewa dengan pelayanan yang diberikan sekelas hotel Bintang 4 ini. Tanggal 14 Juli 2024 saya keluar dari kamar untuk aktivitas jam 04.00, posisi barang-barang pribadi saya rapikan dan dimasukan ke dalam koper dan tertinggal perlengkapan mandi di kamar mandi. Selesai aktivitas jam 09.00 saya kembali ke hotel dan langsung menuju tempat breakfast. Sekitar pukul 09.30 saya kembali menuju kamar dan betapa terkejutnya saya bahwa kamar saya dalam kondisi terbuka, selimut, bed cover sudah dalam kondisi tidak di tempat tidur. Padahal saya saat itu belum cek out dan tidak ada konfirmasi ke saya dari pihak hotel bahwa saya sudah cek out atau belum. Saya kemudian langsung cek koper, dan masih beruntung ternyata koper dan barang berharga masih tertinggal di kamar. Bagaimana hal ini bisa terjadi sekelas hotel Bintang 4?? Saat cek out saya menemui Pak Sapto, duty manager saat itu. Beliau menyampaikan permintaan maaf dengan alasan crew dilapangan salah dengar instruksi dari FO terkait kamar cek out yang seharusnya kamar 811 menjadi 911. Sebenarnya bagi saya itu bukan alasan yang masuk akal untuk hotel sekelas Novotel yang dalam pikiran saya tiap lantai pastinya ada PIC yang bertugas masing-masing. Pada dasarnya saya tidak mau memperpanjang hal ini, pada saat itu juga saya tidak meminta kompensasi apa-apa. Hanya saya minta ke Pak Sapto untuk membuat permintaan maaf tertulis dan disampaikan segera ke email saya. Saya beri waktu di hari senin, namun mungkin saya terlalu berekspektasi terlalu tinggi terhadap ketulusan hotel ini meminta maaf. Sampai hari selasa sore tanggal 16 Juli 2024 dimana ulasan ini saya tulis, surat tersebut belum saya terima. Sungguh pelayanan dan handling customer yang sangat buruk dari hotel ini, kalau bukan dekat dengan tempat acara pasti saya memilih hotel lain yang hospitality jauh lebih baik dari hotel ini.

We thought that Accor Hotel chains supposed to have one of the best information system but this experience proof us wrong. We would think again a million times if we would have to stay in one of the Accor hotel chain again, fearing that the bad experiences like this would happen again.

We stayed 4 nights at Novotel Suites Yogyakarta Malioboro in the Superior Studio room with a King sized bed. This is a hotel that was built in 1997 and last renovated in 2019 so we were a little surprised by the condition of the hotel and the room. Check-in was easy and the front desk staff were all very friendly and helpful (5 stars for all the staff). The room was very spacious and the bed was comfortable. We had a view of the city which was nice. The bathroom had a weird layout which didn‚Äôt work well. But the biggest complaint was the mold in the corner of the room near the shower and along the edges of the carpet. Other aspects of the room seemed dated as well. The walls between room seem very thin and you can often hear your neighbors or sounds from the hallway. Overall the hotel seemed very dated for one that had supposedly been renovated in 2019. Our room included a breakfast which was buffet style and located on the 8th floor. Unfortunately this is also the smoking floor so when you get off the elevator for breakfast you are confronted with the smell of cigarette smoke. You get used to it in Indonesia but still I think maybe the smoking rooms should be on a different floor for those sensitive to the smell of smoke. The buffet breakfast was excellent (5 stars for the food and staff). Lots of options from traditional Indonesian dishes to Western food and a large dining area with outside seating for those that smoke and eat. Bayu was great at making omelets and the rest of the staff were also very friendly and helpful. Made in particular was super helpful and provided great service. The drop off and pickup point of the hotel is odd. There is only a single way in and out so your driver has to turn around to go back out the same way and it‚Äôs quite tight especially when busy. The best part of this hotel is the location to Malioboro street. You are literally right there and can enjoy the shops, restaurants and sights easily by foot. There is a shopping mall right there and oddly a disconnected mall on several of the lower floors of the hotel itself (Malioboro Mall). We stumbled upon it by accident and access seems to have been limited (closed off to the main mall) which unfortunately has affected all the businesses at this location. Overall it was an OK stay and every staff member that we encountered was always super friendly and helpful. I‚Äôd probably stay here again just for the great location to Malioboro street and all the activities there but my wife said she would not stay here again.

Before I arrived the hotel contacted me via whatsapp asking my arrival time and I thought this was a good gesture. The check-in process went well, and I was very happy to be done at the priority check-in desk. (Many of Accor's hotel priority check-in desks are currently not working, even before the Pandemic, so I as a platinum member are not satisfied with this situation.) Road access (for car) is a bit problematic, because Malioboro street is closed between 6 pm - 9 pm or 10 pm and alternative road access is being repaired. However, if you are a hotel guest, you can still access via Malioboro st. during this period with a password, although it is a bit inconvenient as traffic to Malioboro is congested and you need to speak to the police/street officer. The location itself is very strategic, a few steps to Jalan Malioboro, connected to a mall and in the same complex as the Ibis Hotel. I got an upgrade to the executive room (I'm platinum member) and the room was spacious but had no view and the ac didn't work well, so they moved me to a junior suite which I think, even though it's one category under the executive room, it's better. This is due to the fact that the room has a window with a view (though not the best view). in the room there is a mini pantry where a chiller, coffee maker and microwave are available. Moreover, the bathroom in the executive room is small when compared to the junior suite room, even in the junior suite room there is a bathtub. However the cleanliness of the duvet needs to be improved because it was full of old stains, it's a shame because the hotel is not even (seemingly) 3 years old. The wifi is bad but luckily the cellphone signal from the room is quite good. The tv program is good enough, there are some of my favorite channels too. Many choices of breakfast but the taste in my opinion is mediocre. Furthermore, I don't like the treatment one of the restaurant attendant who told me to wear gloves even though I wasn't taking food and only talked to the noodle station chef to place an order. The strange thing was that there were other hotel guests coughing in front of the food and some who don't wear masks when taking food but are not reprimanded by the staff. Gym is too small and very little equipment. the pool is nice but I saw it was packed when they actually have a (if i don't mistaken) no more than 10 person rule during the pandemic. They have a bar on the rooftop but unfortunately the view focuses on the swimming pool, it's a shame it should have been designed by optimizing the view to the city.
